quest.name: A World with Light and Life
journal: Never one to remain idle, Y'shtola would tend to an errand.
objectives: Speak with Zero and have her accompany you.
Speak with Mihleel while Varshahn and Zero are accompanying you.
Head to Balshahn Bazaar while accompanied by Varshahn and Zero, and speak with Zero at the designated location.
Speak with Isu while Varshahn and Zero are accompanying you.
Head to Windweft while accompanied by Varshahn and Zero, and speak with Zero at the designated location.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My chamber is much the same as this one. Too opulent for my taste, but at least it has space to train.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: She seems to be faring better here. Praise be to the Sisters...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Zero's breathing appears to be less strained than it was in the Thirteenth.

dialogue.name: MEGHADUTAEMPLOYEE
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname. If you would follow me, I will show you to the guest chambers.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Meghaduta guest chambers?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If I may excuse myself, I wish to pay a visit to the High Crucible.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While the scales functioned admirably, it would be prudent to have them inspected for signs of degradation.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: By all means. I shall do the same for this vessel.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then I'll go and meet with the soldiers. Share with them what I learned fighting voidsent in the Thirteenth.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: What of you, my friend? Have you any immediate plans?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing in particular.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm just worried about Zero.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I might go and tend to my island.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: In that case, might I trouble you with a small task?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: In that case, might I trouble you with a small task?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Truly? Had I known you had such interests, I might have entrusted you with the development of our nearby isles to attract visitors.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: At any rate, should you be in no hurry, might I trouble you with a small task first?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I wish to have food ready for Zero when she awakens, you see. Would you be willing to go to Mehryde's Meyhane and ask for suitable refreshments?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Excellent. In the meantime, Nidhana shall watch over Zero. She is already en route.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Let us each then tend to our respective businesses and reconvene anon.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Welcome to Mehryde's Meyhane! Please make yourself comfortable.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: What? A guest of the satrap has collapsed from hunger?

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Of course I would be happy to help. You need only tell me what you desire.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Your most expensive dish, just for good measure.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Something light and refreshing. Like fruit perhaps.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: A rich and hearty meal with plenty of meat.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: A modest quantity of a living mortal's aether should suffice.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: While that can certainly be arranged, I fear it would be too rich for someone coming out of a long slumber.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: I would recommend something gentler on the stomach, like these apples here. They're sweet, juicy, and nutritious!

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Ah yes, that would be perfect for someone coming out of a long slumber. Please take these apples with you, then. They've just come in, and I can guarantee their freshness.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: While that might be perfect for an adventurer preparing to raid a treasure vault, I fear it would be too much for someone coming out of a long slumber.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: I would recommend something gentler on the stomach, like these apples here. They've just come in, and I can guarantee their freshness.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Er, I'm afraid we don't serve that particular...delicacy...

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: If I may, I would recommend something gentle on the stomach, like these apples here. They've just come in, and I can guarantee their freshness.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Afterwards, once your guest feels better, she's welcome to sample whatever else we can provide. Just let me know!

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Oh, this is a while ago now, but Professor Jalheen and Azahma were overjoyed to learn of your safe return from the treasure vault. And so they celebrated, and got just about every other patron involved.

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: Not in recent memory has the meyhane been so lively. It was all Mihleel and I could do to keep things orderly, but we too shared in their joy.

dialogue.name: MEGHADUTAEMPLOYEE
dialogue.text: Ah, welcome back. Lest you worry, Mistress Nidhana has been taking good care of our guest.

dialogue.name: MEGHADUTAEMPLOYEE
dialogue.text: Will you be joining them now?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Meghaduta guest chambers?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While at the High Crucible, I spoke with the alchemists about Zero. If you require any assistance, don't hesitate to let them know.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The Thirteenth was far colder than Thavnair. Let's hope Zero doesn't collapse again from the heat...

dialogue.name: NIDHANA
dialogue.text: Should walking prove too taxing, there is always the Aethernet. She shouldn't have trouble making use of it.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: 'Twas my pleasure to show you the city when first you arrived. I shall enjoy doing the same for Zero.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: This world is brimming with aether... I feel invigorated just standing here in the breeze.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Glad am I to hear that. So─is there any place in particular you wish to see?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Perhaps where that food came from─apple, was it? While I don't expect I'll collapse again, it would be good to know where I can procure more if necessary.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Mehryde's Meyhane it is, then. I shall introduce you to the head waitress, Mihleel.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Varshahn and Zero are now accompanying you. Keep them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can leave your quest companions behind by entering a different area, or by speaking with them and selecting the option to part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you wish to have your companions join you again, return and speak with them at the original location.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Small talk.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Part ways.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: While bound to Zenos, I never saw vibrant cities like this. Only ruined places, not so different from the void.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Do you recall the time we traveled together to the outpost? Should our tour take us outside the city, we must make use of hamsa again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with your companions?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Do as you will, but the condition was that you accompany me. I will return to the palace.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: You have urgent business? Very well, we shall await you back at Meghaduta.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: You're here. Good. We can set out again.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: If you have concluded your business, then let us resume our tour.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Discuss Mehryde's Meyhane.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: This is the place? The air is different here, and I speak not of the heat.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: There's a texture to it─a fullness─unlike that of elsewhere.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: You smell the cooking, I believe. Hannish cuisine is quite fragrant─and delicious, I hope you will agree.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: We could attempt to introduce Zero to Mehryde herself, but Mihleel is more likely to be available.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Welcome to Mehryde's Meyhane! Are you by yourself this eveningtoday?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be accompanied by Varshahn and Zero, and have them at your side in order to proceed with quest objectives.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your companions have yet to arrive. Be sure they are at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Welcome to Mehryde's Meyhane!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Mihleel, and may I introduce you to Zero. She is an esteemed guest, and I ask that you see to her meals during her stay.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, Mehryde has told me all! Please come to us whenever you're hungry. We'll look after you.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: 'Twas here that Forename obtained the apple.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: While the palace cooks can prepare whatever you desire, 'tis certainly a quick and convenient food.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I'll remember it.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...Who are the ones there, moving their bodies about? Is it for some ritual related to eating?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: The dancers? They move their bodies to bring pleasure to those who are watching.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: 'Tis a form of entertainment. Part of our culture.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: How needlessly complicated. We voidsent prefer simpler pleasures.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: That may be the way of it now, but your world, too, must have had such “complicated” diversions once.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...I don't remember.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Well, let us move on. I propose we visit Balshahn Bazaar, where goods the world over may be found.

dialogue.name: MIHLEEL
dialogue.text: Be it food, drinks, or dancers, we provide only the finest for your enjoyment!

dialogue.name: MEHRYDE
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to see that His Excellency's guest is back on her feet. She is always welcome here, as are you.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: What are all these things for? What do you do here?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: This is a marketplace─where people buy and sell goods. Since its earliest days, Radz-at-Han has served as a trading hub, and here you'll find not only local products, but wares from distant lands.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I should mention that the vendors generally only accept payment in coin or tomestones. If there is aught you desire, I shall take care of it.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: So that's what tomestones are for... Voidsent returned with them on occasion, but I never knew their purpose.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: They struck me as useless trinkets, and I couldn't understand your obsession with them.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: On that subject, there appeared to be no shops in the Thirteenth. Do you never make bargains in which possessions are exchanged?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: We do, but rarely. We strike bargains when we want something done. If we desire an object, we kill whoever has it.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: I see, I see. Your bargains may be likened to employment, I believe. I shall bear this in mind.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: With that, let us continue on. I propose we head to the High Crucible of Al-Kimiya.

dialogue.name: ISU
dialogue.text: We were told the satrap has a special guest. Is she not with you?

dialogue.name: ISU
dialogue.text: Why, Master Vrtra! How may we serve you this eveningmorningday? If you're here for your vessel, I'm afraid we're still tending to it...

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: No, no, there is no rush. Pray take as much time as you require, and know that I have complete faith in your work.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: The High Crucible is home to the finest alchemists. They are the ones who created my bodies, and can provide you with healing as well.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Now that I think on it, you weren't at all surprised when I changed forms. Were you aware of my nature from the start─that I was a soul occupying a vessel not my own?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: It's hardly uncommon in our world. When given the chance, many shed their bodies to claim stronger ones.

dialogue.name: ISU
dialogue.text: Oh, you must be the rumored guest! We've been most eager to meet you!

dialogue.name: ISU
dialogue.text: If you have a moment, would you care to stay for some tea? The Sisters know we'd love to hear your tales!

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: No. I've had enough food for now, and can always obtain more without the need for inane chatter.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Now, now, no need to decline outright. I daresay you are tired, so let us save it for another time and return to Meghaduta. If aught catches your eye en route, do not hesitate to say so.

dialogue.name: ISU
dialogue.text: Artificial voidsent are a concept we understand well, but partial voidsent─now that is something that upends our established theories! I do hope we have the chance to speak with her at length. And perform a few tests, perhaps...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...Some sort of fruit? Pitiful things, though. I imagine you'd need to eat a lot to derive any satisfaction.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: These are mulberry trees. While the fruits are indeed edible, more important are the leaves, which we feed to silkworms. Without the creatures, we wouldn't have the silk to make our famous Thavnairian weave.

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Furthermore, the bark of the tree also possesses medicinal properties. You would be hard-pressed to find a more useful plant.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Is that so... Aside from food, I wouldn't have considered any other purpose for it.

dialogue.name: MEHRAHD
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Boy's Voice-)<gasp> Master Vrtra! And Forename too!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: If it isn't young Mehrahd. And that must be your sister, Yahsra. Is all well at the orphanage?

dialogue.name: MEHRAHD
dialogue.text: Yes, Your Excellency. The other children are very nice, and we all look out for one another.

dialogue.name: YAHSRA
dialogue.text: Oh, oh! Just the other day, Estinien came to see us! Everyone was really excited!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: Truly? Estinien paid you a visit?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: ...That is well.

dialogue.name: MEHRAHD
dialogue.text: Is she a new friend?

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Friend... You know what that is?

dialogue.name: MEHRAHD
dialogue.text: What!? You mean you don't!?

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: She is a visitor from a faraway land, you see, and is still unfamiliar with our language.

dialogue.name: YAHSRA
dialogue.text: Then we'll teach you! A friend is someone you like to play with!

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Play with...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Zenos seemed to be enjoying himself when he fought you. Is that the same thing?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: More or less.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Absolutely not.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: I see. But...is having someone to play with so fulfilling? I still do not understand why.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Then I'm no closer to understanding it.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Why he traversed the great expanse─why he risked life and limb...for you...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...But I waste energy dwelling on such things. I am not Zenos. I stand to gain nothing by knowing his heart.

dialogue.name: YAHSRA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry I couldn't explain it well...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: There's no need to apologize. The fault is not yours, but mine for failing to make sense of your words.

dialogue.name: MEHRAHD
dialogue.text: Well, we had better get back to our errand.

dialogue.name: YAHSRA
dialogue.text: Good-bye! It was nice meeting you!

dialogue.name: VARSHAHN
dialogue.text: What is a friend? 'Tis a seemingly simple question, but the answer is anything but. Only a child, innocent and pure, could reply with nary a moment's hesitation.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: Through Zenos, I thought I understood the ways of your world.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: But the more I learn of it, the more I realize how little I actually know. It's all so strange─your behavior and your reasons. I find myself baffled at every turn.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSPERSON
dialogue.text: ...But the feeling is not unwelcome. I'm...learning, bit by bit. It was the right decision to join you.
